front.title: ECN and DSCP support for HTTPS's Connect-UDP

abstract.t: HTTP's Extended Connect's Connect-UDP protocol enables a client to proxy a UDP flow from the HTTP server towards a specified target IP address and UDP port. QUIC and Real-time transport protocol (RTP) are examples of transport protocols that use UDP and support Explicit Congestion Notification (ECN) and provide the necessary feedback. This document specifies how ECN and DSCP can be supported through an extension to the Connect-UDP protocol for HTTP.
